snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio declared that New York, which his opponents once said would grow more dangerous under his watch, had in fact become even safer.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio announces that city's crime rate continues to decline in 2014; drop in number of stop-and-frisk encounters does not seem to have encouraged violence as some predicted; new marijuana policy has resulted in sharp decline in arrests in first two weeks of implementation.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio declared that New York, which his opponents once said would grow more dangerous under his watch, had in fact become even safer.

headline.main: New York Crime Keeps Falling, Mayor de Blasio Says; Cites Years of ‘Momentum’
headline.print_headline: De Blasio Says Crime Continues to Decline; Cites Years of ‘Momentum’
